when_to_use: Website contains large amount of content requiring quick discovery
Users may not know exact location within navigation structure
Providing alternative navigation method to complement primary navigation
Site serves diverse user needs where browsing alone is insufficient
when_not_to_use: Website has simple structure with minimal, easily navigated content
Content doesn't lend itself to keyword searching
Cannot commit resources to maintaining quality search results
best_practices: Position consistently across site, typically in header or utility navigation
Include visible label or clear placeholder text
Size appropriately for typical search queries
Include visually distinct search button with clear label or icon
Ensure mobile optimization with responsive design
Provide keyboard accessibility and proper focus states
Handle errors gracefully with helpful guidance
Optimize performance for quick results delivery

wcag_issues: 2.5.8 Target Size (Minimum): Target size does not meet WCAG 2.2 Level AA requirements (24x24 CSS pixels minimum)
accessibility.notes: Generally meets accessibility requirements but needs target size adjustment

desktop.behavior: Full text and icon display with hover effects

known_issues: Target size compliance: Does not meet WCAG 2.2 minimum target size requirements
Mobile text visibility: Search text is hidden on mobile which may impact discoverability
Search activation: Requires navigation to search page rather than inline search
variations: Inline search: Search box appears directly in interface, typically in header
Popover search: Search box appears in popover panel when search icon is clicked

findings: Search button disabled until valid query prevents unfavorable results scenarios
Based on previous commercial project learnings
